title: Court séjour à Marrakech
comment: Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel avec une amie courant Janvier et nous avons vraiment apprécié le lieu. L'hôtel est calme et donc idéal pour le repos tout en étant à 10mn du centre de Marrakech en voiture (navettes gratuites toutes les heures au départ de l'hôtel). Les chambres sont spacieuses et propres. Le personnel est vraiment adorable. En ce qui concerne la formule tout inclus, nous avons été très satisfaites des plats proposés (jus d'orange frais au petit-déjeuner, crêpes, pain perdu...). Les seuls bémols: la piscine intérieure et les coffres dans les chambres sont payants.

title: Jagershof-Kerlinga ou l'art d'arnaquer les gens
comment:
Quand vous venez pour acheter : on vous fait courbettes, et sourires, profitez-en car après.... c'est tout autre chose!
Les proprio passent à côté de vous sans même dire bonjour, si vous demandez qque chose : on vous envoye au diable.
Tout est bon pour faire du fric : 17€ de supplément pour les poubelles, on paye pour le chien, pour les douches, et même la marchande de soupe ou de glace doit s'acquitter d'un droit d'entrée... si c'est pas arnaque ?
Faut aller voir l'allée d'entrée, les vieux chalets abandonnés, les parcelles vides et non entretenues et pas oublier le sourire de la vieille patronne qui serait sans doute mieux au home qu'à rôder com un corbeau .... 
Beurk

title: Avis mitigé sur l'Hotel Marconi Milan
comment:
Ensemble correct mais ne vaut pas les 4 étoiles...
des parties sont en travaux...
une partie de l'hôtel donne sur une rue passante notamment des tramways bruyants.
le personnel à l'accueil n'est pas très accueillant...

title: Vous ne serez pas déçus
comment:
Hotel design épuré et trés agréable pour les yeux.
Chambre spacieuse, avec grande baies vitrées.
D'une propreté irréprochable, ménage fait intégralement tous les jours.
Tout confort, dont le lit trés spacieux , mini-bar .
Salle de bains avec séche cheveux intégré, trés pratique.
Calme trés appréciable
Petit déjeuner trés copieux et appétissant
Salles de remise en forme dont hammam et sauna,sont vraiment un bien être apprécié aprés une journée touristique !!
Proximité de la ville, pas besoin de voiture.
Prix raisonnable et en rapport avec toutes les prestations founies.
 BEMOLS:
- l'accueil ,certes charmant ,mais ne parle pas du tout le français, handicap pour les touristes qui ne possédent qu'une langue.
- Le parking trés cher, approximativement 15e/ jour et aucune possibilité de parking gratuit aux alentours.

title: Bonne suprise! Hôtel simple, propre et bien situé!
comment:
Un hôtel qui a première vue semble un peu vieillot. Mais notre étage venait d'être rénové. 
D'où notre surprise à la découverte de notre chambre: décoration moderne, deux lits de bonne taille, armoire, ceintres, une salle de bain neuve avec une douche assez spacieuse...
Le prix est vraime,t attractif, en plein sur les ramblas! Idéal pour jeune couple ou amis!! 
Le +, la vue imprenable sur les cheminée du "Palau Guëll" !!

title: Un conte fantastique...à l'américaine
comment: un Abord digne des contes fantastiques avec ses tours colorées et illuminées la nuit et puis le monde du jeu , vivant  , qui ne s’arrête jamais. l "accueil et le service sont très professionnels. La chambre est grande, simple avec l'ensemble des services nécessaires, y compris une Wifi par câble.   la salle de jeu est grande et active. Avec plusieurs entrées , un concierge, de nombreux bars, restaurants au premier étage et service divers, tout est simple et pratique.  la chambre était à un prix modique avoir un voucher de 20 euros pour les bars/snacks... ideal pour un court séjour en vue de découvrir "Vegas"

title: Vacances de rêve !!!!
comment:
j'ai lu tous les commentaires sur ce forum parce que j'avais réservé des vacances au sen-yan et je voulais annuler!!!!
j'y suis allée en famille et j'ai passé 15 jours de rêve: l'endroit est magnifique, l'ambiance est extra, il y a des animations pour tous les âges et le clou sont les jeunes de la troupe imagine qui présente des spectacles de très très grande qualité 
camping que je recommande chaleureusement !!!

title: Du 02 au 09 juillet,beau temps,mobil home neuf.
comment: Notre arrivée sous le soleil fut pénible,inscriptions à revoir,trop long et attente à l'extérieur.Nous avons eu du beau temps,le personnel du camping nous a fait une présentation superbe et un spectacle en semaine payant,mais de haute qualité.Le restau est cher mais bon.Les tobbogans ne sont pas assez dispos et pour les ados pas grand chose.Le terrain de pétanque est petit et l'organisation des concours à revoir.Sinon les piscines et la plage étaient tranquiles,c'était début juillet.

title: Séjour à Milan magasin à coter
comment: on est partit avec des amis et quand on est arriver on etais très etonner de la taille des chambre elles sont grande et pour le prix sa vaut le coût. Le personnel etais très aimable avec nous il parlait un petit peu francais mais il se debrouillais bien. je le recommande a tous le monde. Et pour aller a la cathedrale il faut prendre le metro qui est a proximiter.

title: Nuits blanches à Punta Cana!
comment: Ne pas aller dans cette hotel si vous souhaitez dormir la nuit et passer des vacances sereines... En effet, cet hotel est en accord avec des universités de tous pays pour recevoir des groupes d étudiants entre 20 -22 ans, par vagues de 200! ( cela durant toute l année) Batailles entres chambres, cris, rires, portes qui claquent, poker dans les couloirs, rentrées de boite de nuit bien arrosées... Donc nuits blanches assurées pour toute la famille!( La direction de l hotel ignorant les multiples plaintes quotidiennes). De plus si vous espérez vous reposer sur les transats... Ce ne sera  pas ici le coin de paradis! Les transats sont tous dans un piteux états! Donc très très inconfortables pour vous remettre des folles nuits blanches!

hotel.name: Caribe Club Princess Beach Resort & Spa

title: Superbe hotel
comment: Cette hotel est magnifique et fantastique beaucoup de tobbogans et tres bien pour les enfants Attention il y a 3 titanic a hurghada ses 3 hotels différents  titanic palace titanic beach et titanic resort. Celui si ses titanic resort qui est tres bien a 400 m de la plage et les autres beaucoup moins bien qui n a rien n avoir avec l hotel on ne peut pas y allez.le seul critique ses la nourriture mais avec le prix que j ai payer je n est rien dit JE VOUS LE CONSEIL

title: Hôtel Ayre Rosselon
comment:
Dans l'ensemble, un très bon séjour dans cet hôtel ! Il est moderne, propre, et central - à côté de la Sagrada Familia et du métro.

La chambre est spacieuse et très confortable. En revanche, on n'a trouvé que c'était un peu bruyant, il vaut mieux avoir une chambre du côtéde la Sagrade Familia, mais ça vous reviendra plus cher.

Quoiqu'il en soit, le petit déjeuner est un bonheur, avec beaucoup de choix et des produits frais.

Personnel sympa!

title: TB
comment:
j'ai séjourné à l'hôtel rey juan carlos lors d'un business trip, c'était très cool, j'y étais avec plusieurs colègues.

chambres grandes et bien décorées, propres

l'hotel est éloigné du centre ville, ms ça ne nous a pas vraiment dérangés, l'important, c'était pour nous d'être au calme et de pouvoir nous détendre après une journée de boulot pas forcément rigolotte. Mission accomplie.

Mention spéciale sur les beaux jardins.

title: Pas mal mais peut mieux faire
comment: Une 40 aine de chambre, hôtel plein centre ville, à proximité de toutes les commodités (transport et commerces). Accueil sympathique. Quelques détails gênant, une majorité de chambre modernes en déco mais équipées uniquement avec une douche et une salle de bain minimaliste. Les chambres du rez de chaussée sont ouvertes sur le trottoir très passant, on est obligé de rester rideaux fermés pour un peu d'intimité. Enfin l'isolation sonore est un problème, emmenez les boules pour les oreilles si vous visez une grasse matinée.

title: Même par temps de pluie toujours joyeux
comment: l'htel a 6etages mais trés silencieu ,moquette dans les couloirs ,aucun bruit de valises ni de pas.la propreté trés satisfaisante trés bon buffet pour le petit dej et a toute heure  il peuvent vous servire un encas.

hotel.name: Hotel Ibis Paris Gare de Lyon Diderot 12ème

title: Un écrin de verdure
comment:
Au Camping La Venise Verte, à Coulon, point stratégique du marais Poitevin, vous rencontrerez  la propriétaire, une charmante dame qui 
participe avec efficacité et discrétion au déroulement de votre séjour.
Installé au cœur du marais, proche du très joli village de Coulon au bord de la Sèvre Niortaise, le camp offre un confort sans égal, équipements, tenue, propreté. La délicieuse personne dont je vous parlai plus haut, orientera utilement vos sorties touristiques, n'oubliez pas de passer par le restaurant du camp digne d'un établissement étoilé.
Caude Caroline ALOE  Saint Jean d'Angély

title: De retour en 2013
comment: Depuis 3 ans nous venons au camping et nous y retournerons encore. Toujours aussi bon accueil, les sanitaires toujours aussi propres nettoyer bien sur 2 fois par jour, le resto  nickel les pizzas très bonnes, cette année nous avons eu les soirées moules frites, les moules et l'aïoli maison un délice.  Le site est magnifique avec sa rivière accès direct un régal pour toute notre famille. A l'année prochaine

title: Amis vacanciers, fuyez cet hotel
comment: Bonne odeur d'egout dans les batiments 4OOO !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!pas de changement de draps en 15 jours (chaud , on sue)!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Animation mediocre, tres en dessous de la ceinture!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! restauration identique tout au long du sejour (poulet, dinde, boulettes à toutes les sauces et à tous les jours......ecoeurant à force)!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! et pour finir, Reception se foutant pas mal de vous........ Hotel reellement en dessous de tout, j'aimais la Turquie mais cet hotel m'a tellement decu que je n'y retournerais plus ! JE retournerais volontiers à Djerba (essayez le FIESTA  ou le Laico, et vous apprecierez les bonnes vacances) SUR !

title: Hôtel Kyriad pas de qualité de service client
comment: plus de kiriad je verais un autre hotel car je souhaite retrouver dans un hotel une chaleur presque familliale "comme a la maison " cela exsiste dans certain hotel mais pas dans celui la don je vais tester d'autres hotel pour voir

hotel.name: Hotel Kyriad Paris 10 - Gare du Nord

title: Aucune hésitation
comment:
En Fance, ce type d' hotel approcherait le 4 éroiles pour la structure , et le 2 étoiles pour le prix( choisir la période du séjour un minimum ) 
Pensez à demander la carte donnant droit à un bon % sur les repas des votre arrivée
Au bout du strip, mais pas réellement un probléme car ligne de bus passe devant l' hotel 
Attractions trés américaines pour les personnes recherchant des sensations ( en dehors des tables de jeux )

title: Sympa pour quelques jours !
comment: Super séjour de visite a Lyon et aussi grâce a l'hôtel ! Des lits confortables, la TV avec pas mal de chaines et une grande salle de bain :) Seul reproche pas assez de places dans les placards pour ses affaires.

title: Super vacances
comment: nous avons passé une semaine à la sardane, et que dire à part que l'on a passé un super séjour, super camping, idéalement placé entre la plage, le port et les commerces, tout se fait à pied, et collioure en bateau....bref de super vacances, nos enfants se sont éclatés entre la piscine, l'aire de jeu et les copains...ils n'avaient pas envie de partir...mobil home super bien placé, pas ou peu de bruit la nuit...et oui on reviendra...

title: Hôtel pratique pour affaire
comment: Première réservation dans cette chaine, j'ai été très agréablement surprise. L'hôtel est situé dans la zone village auto, à la sortie d'un rond-point et pourtant aucune nuisance sonore, l'hôtel est très bien insonorisé

title: Pas digne d'un 5 étoiles
comment:
Le décor est très beau, les restaurants très bon.Certaines chambres on droit vers 5h du matin au bruit infernal des ramassages de verres! Et lorsque 'on vous installe dans une chambre plus silencieuse, il n'y a même pas une personne pour vous emmener vos bagages! dans un 5 étoiles!!!
Dans la 2ème chambre, nous avons eu la drôle de surprise de voir que quand on allumait le robinet de la baignoire, l'eau coulait d'abord par terre avant d'aller dans la baignoire tellement ça été bien installé ! Et elle était installée pour 2 alors que nous avions un enfant avec nous. Nous avons attendu toute la journée, en ayant demandé plusieurs fois de nous mettre un lit et du linge de toilette pour l'enfant, ce qui a été fait mais tard le soir.
La clientèle est de tout âge, mais il y avait beaucoup de familles avec enfants.

title: Mon coût de cœur
comment:
Après avoir beaucoup voyager, nous avons été agréablement surpris par cet hôtel et le pays bien sur!!
Les employés sont aux petits soin, les chambres sont très propres et pour couronner les tous ils sont toujours souriant et très polis. Un agréables sejour dans cet hôtel qui n'étais pas peupler de touriste quoi demander de mieux lorsqu'on part avec des enfant en bas age. Par ailleurs le club enfants étais très bien il y a même des garde d'enfant, génial pour un dîner en amoureux( les mauriciens adorent les enfant) j'ai vraiment eu un coup de cœur pour l'hôtel et les mauriciens et je compte bien y retourner

title: Simple et accueillant
comment:
Simple, accueillant, pas très cher... Les transports sont au pied de l'hôtel, la gare de l'est à deux pas, commerces, restaurants sympathiques tout à côté. 
Pour une réunion à Paris, c'est parfait !

title: Un hôtel très pratique
comment:
Un hôtel sympathique si on est à plusieurs, car sinon aucun loisirs ou activités possible, hormis sortir en ville.
Mais très pratique si on souhaite juste dormir quelques nuits, si on doit être sur Paris à moindre coût.

hotel.name: CISP Centre International de Séjour de Paris Kellerman

title: Très très sale .....
comment:
Manque d'hygiène...
Pas d'animation....
On s'ennuie à mourir et pourtant coincé jusqu'au 1 er décembre ...
Photos à l'appui me serviront de preuves pour introduire une réclamation et dédommagement !!! 
On vient se reposer, on est encore plus fatigué, changement de chambre à trois reprises .... et la 3 eme pffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff
déçue à un point inimaginable !!!!
Ne pas se fier aux beaux commentaires et belles photos qui sont là pour appâter le client  .... On pourrait dire tellement de choses !!!! mais rien de bon, vraiment et je ne suis pourtant pas difficile !!!
La nourriture ......................... NO COMMENT !!!

title: Magnifique
comment: sejour excellent, pas d'ennui, décor superbe, piscine etc juste dommage que internet ne passe pas partout. A part cela cetait parfait. la piscine est spacieuse, le golf touche la residence dommage qu'il faille une voiture pour les courses c'est tout

title: Très bon rapport qualité / prix
comment: Un hôtel idéalement situé à 1 km de l'autoroute, 85 km au sud de Florence, en pleine campagne Toscane. Idéal pour une étape. Calme et plutôt luxueux pour le prix. Les chambres sont très confortables et bien isolées. Le personnel est absolument charmant. Le restaurant, dans un cadre assez sobre, présente aussi un bon rapport qualité / prix et permet de déguster d'excellentes spécialités dont certaines typiquement toscanes. Cet établissement est une étape très fréquentée par les chauffeurs routiers et cela n'en fait pas pour autant un endroit bruyant. Le matin, on s'aperçoit que tous les camions sont partis sans qu'on ait rien entendu. Les chauffeurs sont sympathiques et courtois. C'est la 2e fois en 4 ans que nous nous y arrêtons et nous y retournerons sans hésiter.

title: Magnifique hôtel très design et décontracté
comment: Séjour magnifique à l'hôtel Bloom! L'hôtel est très bien placé à côté du jardin botanique. Une station de métro, une station de vill'o (les vélibs bruxellois) et le tram  sont juste en face de l'hôtel. Par contre, le quartier avoisinant (Schaerbeek) est un peu crade.  L'hôtel même est très design et moderne. Le lobby fait peut-être un peu trop "aéroport" mais le parfum d'ambiance qu'ils diffusent suscite tout de suite un sentiment de confort. Le rapport qualité- prix est super! Encore mieux quand on a le pdj inclut (25 euros sinon). Les réceptionnistes sont très sympas, serviables et pour la plupart anglophone mais parlent aussi français. La propreté a été irréprochable. Il  n'y a vraiment rien de négatif à dire.

title: Hôtel B&B Malakoff, Paris
comment:
un hôtel bien situé pour visiter paris et ses alentours.
Malgré le fait que c'est une chambre relativement petite, celle-ci est bien organisée et fonctionnelle. Les éléments d'hygiène fournit (serviettes, gobelet, drap...) sont tout blanc et propre. L'hôtel en lui-même n'a pas beaucoup d'originalité mais sa situation géographique permet de prendre les lignes de transport en un rien de temps. Cela permet de laisser sa voiture au parking (qui est payant)

hotel.name: B&B Hotel Paris Malakoff Parc des Expositions

title: Vaut le déplacement
comment:
Nous avons passé 3 semaines au camping le Roussillonnais dans un bungalow, il était peut être un peu petit mais très confortable. Très près de la mer,  nous avons pu profiter pleinement de cette dernière et le sable est propre et fin.
Le personnel du camping est à l'écoute des vacanciers. Le contre commercial du camping est très pratique (du pain à toutes heures). Nous avons vraiment apprécié notre séjour et y retournons cette année.

title: “retour de vacances 1ère semaine de juin”
comment: De retour de Rhodes ce matin. Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cet hôtel qui mérite bien ses 5 étoiles. Beaucoup d'espace, de calme, de fraîcheur avec toutes ses piscines en accès direct avec les chambres en rez-de-chaussée. Le personnel est toujours souriant. Seul petit bémol, la langue française est peu pratiquée, ce qui est dommage à la réception et nous devons parler anglais - cependant le personnel du restaurant fait de nombreux efforts pour parler et comprendre notre langue : un grand bravo à Victoria, Christina et Nelu, nos serveurs. Les repas en buffet sont excellents, variés et en quantité. Le soir, animation musicale soft avec chanteurs, danses grecques, très appréciée. Nous avons passé d'excellents vacances.

title: N'y allez pas - don't go!
comment:
Nous avons séjournons dans cet hôtel durant trois nuits et à part la vue sur la mer (qui est en supplément) rien dans cet hôtel n'a d'intérêt la chambre était vieillotte et pas vraiment propre, les serviettes de bain ressemblait a un dessus de lit découper, les personnes à l'accueil n'était pas vraiment souriante et même plutôt désagréable et internet était payant 5h/3h (bien entendu le wifi ne fonctionnait pas dans la chambre)  alors que la nuit nous coûtait tout de même 135€ par nuit 

Si vous avez la possibilité de séjourner ailleurs sur cette magnifique île n'hésitez pas

title: Bon rapport qualité-prix (offre avec agence)
comment:
Très bon rapport qualité prix grâce à l'offre du agence.

Les prix affiché dans la chambre (160 à 200 euro) ne devrait pourtant pas laisser passer certains détails (taille de la douche étroite, quelques joints  douteux à l'intérieur de la douche, fuite de la cabine de douche dans la salle de bain, propreté de l'escalier à revoir, des mies écrasées sont restées 3 jours sur une marche !).

Ces détails ne nous ont pas dérangé mais quelqu'un qui paie plein tarif doit être un peu déçu.

Petite déjeuner très varié et copieux, il manque cependant des vrais jus de fruits (actuellement poudre diluée au distributeur de boissons)

personnel aimable.

Bonne localisation de l’hôtel: 5-10 minutes de la gare Termini et accès métro.

On repartira avec plaisir dans cet hôtel si une offre similaire se présente.

title: Bien mais pas top
comment: Séjour effectué avec des amis pour la fin de l'année, la réceptionniste nous a conseillé une soirée où nous rendre le 31.12, sympa et efficace. Comme trop souvent pour les hôtels Mercure, je me demande ce qui peut effectivement justifier une 4e étoile : pas de minibar, pas de coffre-fort, des lits minuscules. Au mieux, un bon 3*. De plus, contrairement à ce qui était indiqué sur hotels.com lors de la réservation, pas de peignoir ni pantoufle ! Points positifs : propreté des chambres, emplacement relativement proche du centre (à peine 10 min à pied), petit-déjeuner agréable et varié.

title: A REFAIRE !!!!
comment:
Nous venons de passer une semaine dans ce camping via 
un Tour Opérateur et très bon rapport qualité prix. Nous étions dans une tente équipée et avec vue sur la mer et la Ciotat ! Pas très loin des sanitaires (en très bon état et nettoyés une à deux fois par jour !)  Equipe à votre service et la personne du Tour Opérateur fait en sorte que vous n'ayez qu'à vous reposer (très cool sur  les horaires de départ !)
La piscine bien, peut être un peu petite en pleine saison mais voila !
Pour le bruit : ligne de chemin de fer à proximité mais nous ne l'entendions pas, juste un peu le bruit de la route, mais vous etes sur la côte !

hotel.name: La Baie des Anges (f. Les Oliviers)****

title: Hôtel pour petit budget
comment:
Côtés négatifs:
Hotel sans ascenseur, escalier raide et long,à éviter si on a de lourdes valises
Chambres minuscules, impossible de passer si une valise est ouverte sur le sol; lits séparés très étroits, salle de bain minuscule, pieds dans la douche lorsqu'on est sur le WC...!!!
Petit déjeuner dans un autre hôtel à environ 250m, réception ouverte de façon restreinte
Côtés positifs:
 Personnel très aimable, ils vous aident à monter vos bagages, et sont très serviables et sympathiques
Chambres donnant sur un jardin donc très tranquilles
Proximité du tram et du bus

title: Hôtel casino magnifique
comment:
Cet hôtel/casino est l'un des plus beau de Las Vegas. 
Les chambres standards sont très grandes (environ 60 m²) et les équipements sont plus que complets (tv 40" dans la chambre, tv 20" dans la salle de bain, équipements pour Ipod).
Le lit est King size et très confortable.
L'hôtel comprend, outre le casino, un grand nombre de bars et restaurants, souvent de très bonne qualité (et le prix qui va avec).
Au final, la chambre est à un rapport qualité/prix excellent, impossible de trouver cela en Europe.

title: Dommage
comment: L'hôtel est situé dans un immeuble d'habitation, il faut donc sonner à un interphone pour rentrer. Problème: on est réveillé à toute heure par cet interphone la nuit. Les chambres sont très défraîchis et petites. Nôtre fenêtre donnait sur une cour intérieure glauque, plus exactement sur la cuisine du voisin, et comme elles ne fermaient pas ça sentait le graillon dans la chambre. La climatisation de la salle de bain est très bruyante (nous avions le luxe d'avoir notre salle de bain). Il y avait des cheveux et des tâches suspectes sur le coussin du lit. Le personnel est adorable mais il ne faut pas y rester plus d'un week-end et que pour dormir. Bien trop cher pour ce que c'est.

title: Bon rapport qualite / prix  pour la région
comment:
nous souhaitions un camping correct( confort d' un vrai 3 étoiles) en locatif pas trop chère (tente) , dans un environnement sympas , pour 8 jours.
et bien globalement , nous ne regrettons  pas ce camping bien au contraire !
jeunes patrons sympas  ,dévolues a leur affaire (quand on connait leur parcours, je dit bravo aux résultats de leur ambitions !)
nous étions au bord de la rivière en toile pagan fin juillet 2012, beaucoup de choses a faire et a voir a 1 h a la ronde , dépaysant , reposant et sportif, bref de vraies vacances. nous souhaitons a ce camping et a leurs gérants une bonne continuation et une bonne réussite pour la suite . kenavo ! 
des bretons

title: Le plus mauvais des Iberostars.
comment:
Erreur de la part de Ibersostar lors de la réservation, nous nous sommes retrouvés à 2hr du matin avec notre bébé de 14 mois sans chambre, nous avons dû prendre le Taxi et partir dans un autre hôtel pour une nuit. La récéptionniste d'Iberostar n'a pas voulu reconnaître leur erreur et était méchante et désagréable.
La nourriture n'était pas bonne, et le choix n'était pas grand.
Il y avait une mauvaise odeur à l'hôtel (surtout à l'entrée du restaurant). 
La piscine pour bébé n'était pas chauffée. Beaucoup de petits travaux à prévoir (carrelages cassés...).

title: Avis hôtel Ibis Mataro, Barcelone
comment:
Hôtel agréable, une bonne semaine passée et un bon souvenir! 
Je recommande, c'est un hôtel très propre!
Hôtel bien disposé près de la ville mais pas trop loin parfait pour éviter les bruits de la ville.

title: Déçus de mes vacances
comment:
nous sommes allés au camping de pujol 2 semaines au mois d'aout. l’accueil est très médiocre et mal-aimable.les sanitaires sont hypers sales, des cabines ex: tablette cassé, pas de pomme de douche...les animations sont démodé et pas d'animation pour les enfants en journée.les gérantes du restaurant ne savent pas dire "bonjour". pas de connexion wifi. c’était beaucoup mieux l'année derniers très déçus de s'est année 
les emplacements sont ombragé et au calme seuls point positif.
on changera de camping l'année prochaine.

title: Camping familial, convivial et calme
comment: Nous venons de passer 2 semaines au Camping Les Peupliers a Montalivet. Nous avons reçu un accueil très chaleureux et les emplacements sont très spacieux. Une ambiance conviviale règne sur le terrain géré par des nouveaux propriétaires très sympathiques.

title: Un des meilleurs hôtels rapport qualité-prix
comment: "J'ai eu l'occasion de séjourner environ 6 nuits pour des raisons professionnelles entre août et novembre 2012 et je dois dire qu'en comparaison avec d'autres hôtels sur Genève, le Warwick apporte un must. L'accueil se fait par le nom de famille, personne compétente parlant plusieurs langues, chambres impeccables, 2 fois j'ai eu un Upgrade. Salle de bains assez grande. J'ai mangé deux fois au restaurant Teseo, une fois cela été, sans plus, la deuxième à été très bon. Très bien situé, en face de la gare, accès en 5 minutes au lac, en 15 min au centre ville. J'y retournerai très volontiers en 2013."

title: Hôtel très agréable et silencieux
comment: Chambres très silencieuses avec une superbe vue. l'accueil est très agréable et rapide. Chambres récemment rénovées avec intérieur en bois. salle de bain très agréable. vue très agréables sur Bercy village et Paris

title: Vacance
comment: nous accompagnons nos enfants et pt enfants depuis deux annees  le chalet  confortable propre dans un cadre magnifique accueil exellent  air de jeux adapte aux enfants et g parents que dire de plus nous avons passez d exellente vacance merci a toute l equipe des chalets des ayes  les g parents choisi

title: Magnifique hôtel et service adorable
comment: si l'hotel est de grande taille, le logement en bungalow permet à chacun d'avoir son intimité. Les chambre sont impeccable (nettoyage 1 à 2 fois par jour). Les 1ers prix offre une surface de chambre (avec terrasse) confortable (environ30 m²).  L'hotel bénéficie de 3 restaurant, ce qui permet de varier les menus. l’équipe parle le français, l'anglais et l'espagnol couramment.

title: Calme et tranquilité
comment:
Le Val d'Arimont est situé en plein coeur de la nature. Point de départ pour faire de magnifiques balades. La neige était au rendez-vous, et nous en avons bien profité!!! Les paysages étaient encore plus beaux!!!
Les chalets sont très confortables et très propres. Le bistrot-restaurant offre une belle carte permettant de se restaurer sur place sans se ruiner. Espace piscine couverte-jacuzzi-hammam bien agréable en plein hiver (bien chauffé).  Un petit clin d'oeil à la réceptionniste qui est super sympa! Pareil pour les patrons!
Bref, que du positif!!! On ré-essayera en été...

title: Une vrai arnaque
comment:
camping les vignes lit et mixe,de retour des vacances de pâques nous avons eu que des soucis et c'était pareil pour tout les résidents,
piscine couverte et chauffée en panne et il a fallu que le mari de la gérante revienne de ses 2 jours  de repos pour bien vouloir résoudre le problème,le wifi et la machine a laver étaient en panne aussi
accueil désagreable des gérants,une semaine de mauvais tps sans piscine non merci ATTENTION

title: Hotel full of Russians and children
comment: Hotel was full of badly behaved children who rushed in front of you almost knocking you over. The Russian parents had no control over them at any time.  The food was very basic, but edible with good bread, soup and desserts. Room was very clean and large with english speaking room boy who was very polite and helpfull. The bar staff looked tired and overworked but did make an effort to smile and make nice comments to you once they knew you were English. Not suitable for couples without children as evening entertainment was almost nill and geared for families.

title: Nicest hotel ever!
comment: This was my favourite holiday place I have ever been to! Will definitely be retuning, advise people to go here for a great holiday! People are great! Staff are great and the whole holiday package was fantastic!

title: Weekend stay in Madrid
comment: We stayed at the hostal for two nights at the weekend. If you are looking for a cheap hostel in the centre of Madrid and do not need any other services, it is worth trying. Anyway, there is no chance to have breakfast, no restaurant at the hotel. On the other hand a big advantage of the hostel is its placement at the very centre of Madrid with a walking distance to Sol, Gran Via etc. I would recommend the hostel only for a short stay in the city.

title: Bonne hotel
comment:
The location is fantastic, so close to the Louvre and many other sights and also had a balcony, good size flat-screen TV, very comfy bed, in-room artwork very nice.
The location was the most appealing aspect of this hotel, so close to The Louvre and walking distance to most other major tourist sights and also to the train stations.
Conseil - attractions: The Hop-On Hop-Off bus is a great way to get around and familiarise yourself with the area - maybe two day ticket is the best as it is too much for one day is you want to get off and look at any of the sights.

title: Very good
comment: A hotel within the Hilton standard. Very comfortable bed and room with sea views. Ideal location for the Forum convention center. Close to the beach and with a shopping center on the other side of the street.

title: Practical
comment: I usually chose the citizen for my overnight layovers in AMS. It’s walking distance from the airport and the rooms, despite being small, are very practical for a one night layover. Stayed one more last month and keep being a happy customer.

title: Practical
comment: I usually chose the citizen for my overnight layovers in AMS. It’s walking distance from the airport and the rooms, despite being small, are very practical for a one night layover. Stayed one more last month and keep being a happy customer.

title: Best place to stay in a very middle of Paris
comment:
Very nice hotel situated in the middle of Paris next to Les Halles metro and RER station. You can easily find connections to every tourist attractions from there. Louvre, Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou and river Seine are less than 5 mins walk. Near hotel there are many bars, pubs, clubs. 
The most disadvantage of the hotel is noise from the fountain situated on square next to the hotel. If you wish to have quiet nights choose the room which is not with a view to square. Rooms with a view on other site are very quiet.
Hotel rooms are equiped with good kitchenete facilities, there is toaster, electric kettle, microwave and dishwasher.

title: Not very good !
comment: Hotel was very nice, clean and well maintained.  However the food was cold, not enough crockery/cutlery etc in restaurants.  Piped music was so loud it made your ears sting!  In the bar areas there were plenty of tables but not enough tables so nowhere to sit.  The visitors were mainly Russian who were treated with respect, served straight away and generally took over everything.  They smoked everywhere which was not pleasant.  As we were a party of 6 British adults this did not go down very well.  We met the General Manager and pointed out all the faults to him - to say he was mortified is an understatement.

title: Antwerp Lindner May 2013
comment:
Comfortable modern hotel close to Central Rail station in Antwerp and shops and restaurants.
Hotel room was too warm, air conditioning not powerful enough to cool room.
No ironing board and iron in room, small table top board and non-steam iron is supplied when requested, but to be honest are useless for removing creases in cotton shirts.
Reasonable breakfast but no low-fat options for milk, yoghurt, cereal etc. compared to my recent visit to Denmark (Scandic Hotel). This is a big issue for me and I'd like to see low-fat options available. Fruit choice is not large. I didn't try the cooked breakfast. I haven't tried the gym but been to see it, quite small but new equipment available.

title: Titanic Beach Spa & Aqua Park
comment: during my stay here at titanic i had a nice welcome by the reseption and the general mangers  then we had a nice meet again with the animation staff , we had a nice big room for us as a couple and a nice pool view , the dinner was always nice there was never a nite were we could not find something to eat the hotel was well looked after and the bar staff and waiters were all help full . the great thing we found this time around we had a welsh animator to speak with if he had any problems .   ,

title: Excelent place for golf and beach
comment:
Golf courses can be easily reached from the hotel, tee times and transport have been organised by the hotel (Ms. Ö.) to my absolut satisfastion, I have made a coupple of good rounds so I'm satisfied twice:).
Hotel offers nice spa, large pool area and enough space on its beach where I enjoyed relaxing after the game. Hospitality and services at the highest level. I will definitely come back!;

title: Tip top - top tip!
comment:
I have to say that I`ve had a very nice holiday in this hotel. Everybody was very kind and friendly. Especially the team of the main restaurant was really professionell and nice. I felt like a princess, sometimes ;-) ! Thank you very much everybody!

I will come back there.

title: Good hotel for a business trip
comment: Overall good hotel. Nice lounge on the top floor. The room was clean, big, air conditioning. There is a little gym in the first floor. The breakfast is correct. The wifi internet connection is good.

title: Dive instructor just the BEST!
comment:
Went to Daniela for the first time. I dived with Samy. What a nice, gentle guy he is! And, because I've been all over the world to dive, he is very, very professional instructor. He sees everything, and you feel save with him. It's just FUN diving with him. During the breaks he tells you everything about marinelife and he knows a lot to tell about it.
Really awsome!
The waiters and household did a great job, even as the kitchenstaff. They do everything to make your stay a pretty nice one. Thumps up for these guys, they work hard and it's great fun with them. Khalid, thanks man!

title: Might be ok for some, but not for me
comment:
I understand that in the Ukraine the hotel standards are not the same as in other areas in the world and this hotel might be a good option in this category, but we did not like it. Next time i would spend the extra money and stay in a better one.

If you are looking at the "budget" hotel and you don't care much about the room size and the available facilities, then this hotel might be an option for you. Donetsk is not a tourist destination and the choices are limited.

I did like the way they solved the food situation, you basically get a budget you can use in a canine like restaurant that was very good.

title: ABSOLUTELY NOT VALUE FOR THE MONEY...
comment: we were completely dissatisfied with the owners' unfriendly attitude,the room was a lot different from its foto in the hotel's internet  site and the room was smelling as bad as being in a hospital...

title: Advertised "Free Parking"
comment: We booked this hotel through Priceline. Our confirmation state "Free Parking" which the hotel will not honor.  At 1.2 euros per hour - this is a scam.  Do not stay here.

title: Crowded, noisy, smelly, unfriendly.
comment: This place is just awful.  Marseillan plage is a really dirty place.  Don't go here if you want a quiet relaxing holiday. The bar at the campsite plays very loud music every night till midnight.  Then you get all the wasted yobs going back to their tents for an all night party.  Wish I'd brought a set of ear plugs.  Our pitch smelt of sewage so didn't do any cooking.  Our neighbours were a group of racist French Chavs who made it clear to us we weren't welcome.  The beaches and swimming pools were totally jammed.  We complained to the campsite but they were unfriendly and weren't interested.  We left after 2 days wish we'd gone sooner.  AVOID!!!!

title: Three stars stated...but where?
comment: This hotel has only one great thing: the friendly staff. It is worn down, not clean and the whole hotel looks like a mess. The only positive is that they are offering free internet in the lobby, some welcome drinks buffet and friendly reception staff. Location is close to the station but this hotel was all in all quite an unpleasant experience looking into the hotel "hardware". Room Tip: Best rooms are in another hotel, not there.

title: Unacceptable
comment:
Upon suggestion of hotel manager during our previous visit, last october we booked directly (not through agency) to obtain a better price for a 5 day stay and we anticipated half of the cost. Unfortunately one of us had a serious accident (with a 10 day stay at hospital) one week before travel to Hasselt, so we had to cancel our trip. Upon contacting the hotel one week before trip to cancel reservation we discovered that no refund will be possible while no advice was provided, during reservation, about cancelling policies. 
We are very very unhappy about this treatment in such serious situation and after staying there a lot of times. So in the future no more trips to this hotel will be booked from our association and we suggest all other people to be very careful.

title: Last minute getaway in Brugge
comment:
We stayed there with our big dog, we pay 20 Euro a night for him, which is I guess normal here in Europe. He was not allowed in the restaurant though, which is also acceptable. 
The staff were very friendly. We didn't stay much in the hotel since we spent most of the days outside. There aren't many English channel on TV unfortunately. The location is ok if you are used to walk. It's about 15-20 minutes easy  walk to the city center. 
When we stayed there, there was a weird smell around the sitting area.

title: Definitely not a five star hotel!
comment: First impression was good. Excellent check in and given all information needed. Then started realizing that the money we paid were far too much for what we got!! All staff excellent and always willing to help but lack of management and easy to see that services not even close to 5 star. Choice of food very poor, not enough staff so employees were running like crazy, and you could tell there is a lack of management!!

title: Absolutely breathtaking
comment: Hotel and Villa Dievole was absolutely stunning. You are located among the vineyards and olive trees. The atmosphere was so relaxing with the gardens, walkways, old buildings and even the staff. This was the most picturesque of Tuscany and I cannot wait until I can go back again.

title: A good choice
comment: Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton South Beach due to a conference and the experience was excellent. Friendly staff, great room, good breakfast, pool and gym. A good choice for those who enjoy comfort and luxury.

title: 4 star hotel amenities but 2 star service
comment:
Hotel ambience is good. Breakfast is above average. Bar is very good. Gym is small but sufficient for standard workouts. Nice wellness and breakfast staffs. Polite and professional. Never tried the spa and swimming pool though.

Free wireless internet connections available in rooms and lobby which made this hotel attractive. Also have several deskstop computers for guest use.

Stayed for 2 months but don't know who is in charge of the hotel. You would'nt know who is the manager or supervisor unless you ask. Everyone looks the same and name badges gives no clue. 

As its located near the Schiphol Airport, at times may get surge of guests whose flights are cancelled. Lots of groups passing in the weekends.

title: 4 star hotel amenities but 2 star service
comment:
Hotel ambience is good. Breakfast is above average. Bar is very good. Gym is small but sufficient for standard workouts. Nice wellness and breakfast staffs. Polite and professional. Never tried the spa and swimming pool though.

Free wireless internet connections available in rooms and lobby which made this hotel attractive. Also have several deskstop computers for guest use.

Stayed for 2 months but don't know who is in charge of the hotel. You would'nt know who is the manager or supervisor unless you ask. Everyone looks the same and name badges gives no clue. 

As its located near the Schiphol Airport, at times may get surge of guests whose flights are cancelled. Lots of groups passing in the weekends.

title: Great place, friendly and efficient staff
comment:
stayed for a weekend, good location between village and beach, accepts dogs - a must for us,  great staff, very helpful
the car park gets a little busy when there is a function on, but all worked out with a bit of cooperation; the breakfast times are fine during the week but I would have preferred a little later cut off on Sunday - again the staff sorted it to everýone's satisfaction. We had a groundfloor room so access for my scootmobile was no problem and parking of the scootmobile was also sorted without any fuss - a great team, staff and management.

title: Best hotel we have been to!
comment: This hotel has everything! Everything is very clean and well looked after, Staff are very friendly and helpfull, lots do do, all in all its an excellent place to stay, we will be going back soon!

title: Titanic Mutinee
comment:
Clean sizeable room with good facilities in the part of the hotel we were in. There were larger and smaller rooms than ours. We were in the 2300 range of rooms.
Food very basic. Although edible it was very very borring.
The all inclusive spirits had a perfume taste to them. Vodka rum brandy whisky although were diffrent had a similar perfume flavouring. I know some people complained.
Service of all staff was wonderful. But a lot of them let you know they wanted tips.
There were a rody russian contingent at the hotel which broke out in fighting on at least one occassion.

title: Dust
comment:
The hotel is remarkable for his position in the town, 10 minutes by foot to get to the nightlife (Rembrantplein).
For the rest it is very dirty (for example we found little insects in the room) and the sheets were not well cleaned (we found stains of I don't want to know what was). In addition the bathroom was very little and not you cannot use the sink if the door was closed because there was no space.
It was not worth of the money we spent for it.

title: Never again!
comment: Hotel is placed about 30 minutes from center of Paris - metro line 12. Area around is awful. Lot of  homeless. We was afraid about our safe. Metro is located about 5-7 minutes from hotel. Near by hotel is lot of trash throw all over the place, we saw also death rat at the street ! Room was not hoovered even 1 tine during 5 days, so it shouldn't happened. Please avoid to be there.

hotel.name: Hotel Suite Novotel Paris Porte de la Chapelle

title: Airport shuttle is not complimentary
comment:
To the hotel from the hotel, the shuttle bus is gratis. But from the hotel to the airport there are some strict rules at this hotel. 

1. Pre-Booking is a must
2. But the ticket at the hotel(bus driver does not sell the ticket)
3. No information provided for the above at the reception unless you ask for that.

Many people are pull out of the shuttle bus because of this.

title: Hotel is perfect!
comment: Splendid hotel near shopping center "Diagonal Mar". Hotel staff very much. While the hotel is not owned by Marriot so the price was much lower. Now almost equal to the price of the Hilton, which is located nearby. In all other respects - great!

title: Great Hotel!
comment: The Hotel Gilde in Deventer, NL on Niuewstraat is the best hotel I have ever been in!  I travel the world and have never seen such a friendly and professional staff!  Every need is attended to very quickly and happily. The food is good.  The rooms are nice and every part of the hotel bright and clean, the gardens and hotel are beautiful! The hotel Manager, Michel stays on top of everything, leads by example and has a well trained staff.  I have been treated like family since I have been staying here (2 months). There is no other hotel in Deventer for me but The Gilde.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone, business travellers and families!

title: Fine classic hotel but service needs to be improved
comment:
First time with a VIP group in this hotel, I had high expectations about this heritage style hotel. The hotel itself is fine, but the staff and service level was below standard.

It started that we had to argue to enter with the coach the parking area in front  in order to off-load luggage. Handing out the keys was slow motion and ineffecient.. At breakfast guests had to ask twice for coffee/tea, used plates remained too long on the tables. 

Questions by my group members were answered politely but not being of help and not offering a solution. 

On the other side the hotel building is full of character and charme

title: Paradise on earth
comment:
rooms are great , but should be separated for smokers and for family with children

a lot of  staff members , but not always efficient  as supervicion is oriented for control of procedure instead of control of the result and client satisfaction  :  staff members have to apply strict procedures and finally not really taking care of the result ( as not responsible for the procedure itself) 

beach activities are linked to tide hours ...  ( only 3 hours / day .. )  and C-beach club mainly restricted to Villa residents ( even if they are not present ... )

hotel.name: Heritage Le Telfair Golf & Spa Resort

title: The worst vacation ever-anything but grand!
comment:
Sheets were stained too 4 times for mgmt to bring new ones all were stained. Food was inedible bacteria haven!!!!
Cannot get any assistance with issues
Pool closes at 7
You are stuck once you book they will not allow you to change hotels.
Now back, no one will reply to emails and they do not answer phones
Only by lingual if you ask for basic Where is the bathroom forget about a conversation. 
Hamburger meat was grey-set out next to hot grill
Elderly beware walking long distances long waits for shuttle if you can find one.....

hotel.name: Grand Sirenis Mayan Beach Resort & Spa

title: Value for money in Derby
comment:
I stayed at the attic room which is the cheapest available in Rangemoor Park Hotel. It is a very small room that is not very pretty, but the sheets were clean and the bed comfy. There is a washbasin in the room and also a kettle with tea and coffee provided and replenished during service. Shared shower and toilets are down the (very steep) stairs and also clean.

Full English breakfast is served on Sundays, it was nothing extraordinary, but for the price alright. On Mondays, breakfast is served in another hotel just across the street - very basic continental with cereals, bread, one type of ham and cheese, juices, hot drinks, etc.

Overall - it's absolutely alright for the price you pay and the breakfast - while nothing special - is a nice plus.

title: Perfect in every way
comment:
Delightful situation and the view of the canal could not have been better. We had eight rooms and all eight couples were made to feel very welcome on arrival. The rooms were clean, big and comfortable. The dinner was excellent and the dining room staff made sure we had a table all to ourselves. 

All of the staff that we met were both efficient and friendly.

title: Nice play but not for holidays
comment:
The hotel is nice and clean, but is very far from any nice sorrundings. I was forced to stay in this area due to my business reason, but oterwise I would not suggest to come here to spend your holidys. You can reach Madrid quite easily by using a nearby bus, but this would take an hour or so down to the city center. 
Anyway the hotel is nice and personnel is very friendly and kind.

title: Great family friendly hotel
comment: Nice hotel with great staff. Food a bit repeatative. Not much choice for English. Lots of eastern European food. ( the Russians where happy) I will go back to this hotel next year as we had a great holiday.

title: Small cheap hotel
comment: It is a very small hotel in 5 km from Orly airport. I couldn't find anything interesting around it. Room was very small and poor. Window of the room was to the roadside and very many cars pass by this road.

title: Excellent hotel
comment: Have stayed for Christmas in this wonderful hotel. Seems to be brand new, staff is very friendly and efficient, nice fitness in the eleventh floor, and rooms with the view over Tallinn

title: Beautiful and quiet
comment: This is a beautiful hotel in lovely grounds in a quiet location a couple of miles outside the city of York - to which it is very well connected by park-and-ride bus service.  The atmosphere is delightfully tranquil and relaxing and it was for us a lovely place to return to after a busy day sightseeing in the City.  The rooms are spacious and well-furnished.  Our only criticism would be the bathroom - which is a little small and in need of updating and refreshing.  That said, it is adequate and immaculately clean.  Room service is excellent too.  Likewise, the restaurant is excellent.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would happily return  when we visit York again

title: Fantastic and luxury place.
comment: I was second time in Egypt. Sunrise Mamlouk is very lovely hotel with interesting architecture an beautiful gardens, the atmosphere was amazing, comfortable room, the food very tasty,and relaxing music in the restaurant. The waiters from Lobby Bar Mina, Weal and Milad Restaurant bar were realy reliable,helpful and litle bit serious. Very important was for me active rest during  holiday.My expectations about that meet team of animators, especially: Aldo and Negga and girls of aerobic.They are proffesional,creative and always smiling young people.The animation team are have positive attitude to life and doing good job in hotel. Thanks to you ,we came back tp Poland satisfied and relaxed.

title: Danish vote
comment:
A super holiday - but: the staff did not understand much english.
A big and nice appartement - but the madrasses of the bed were awfull hard.
And - we stayed without any pension and the kitchenware were very deficient.
We would not have been able to cook a meal og we had to cook water for coffee in a pot.
TV signal was not good and we missed a up to date flat screen.
finally we had to pay 20 Euro for internet for a week - that should be included.
But - a very relaxing stay with nice people and service in top.
A stay we always will remember with joy and happiness

title: Nice hotel
comment:
Spacious room and modern style (not old like in other polish hotel)
Staff well prepared and kind.
Good quality breakfast.
Wi-fi Free and good conncetion.
We tried the restaurant, good quality food but service really really slow, despite not so many people to serve

hotel.city: Wroclaw - Lower Silesia Province - Southern Poland
hotel.name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Wroclaw

title: Good budget location for budget travelers
comment:
The Location is excellent within walking distance to Tivoli and the city center in general, plus being such a huge building you could easily spot it from a distance  and never get lost. The bar on the ground floor is opened till late and serves cheap Carlsberg. Maybe the staff is not as friendly as one can expect but they have to deal with hundreds of guest, maybe one thousand, in busy weekend night, so they may be excused. 
Overall this is a good budget accommodation (I booked one bed in a dorm) for one weekend for people on a  budget. I will be back in my next stay at Copenhagen.

title: OK hostel
comment:
We decided to go to Barcelona just on the spoor of the moment: bought plane tickets just one week before. There were no many hostels still available. The hotel is new and nicely designed, however it doesn't have such a hostel atmosphere. The common area is very small. The room we stayed in was unbelievable small. It was a 6-person dorm, but I think it was originally designed to be a 4-person one. Wasn't that easy to move around. 
Breakfasts aren't included in the price, however there is a supermarket just next door, so you can grab something to eat there.

title: Fantastic view to the old city
comment: The hotel is located in a centre of Tallinn just at a very short walking distance from the old city and at a short driving distance from the airport. I have absolutely nothing to complain about: everything was good. Two things were especially great. The first one was a panoramic view to the old city: the dawning that highlighted it by red sunbeams was absolutely fantastic. The second one was the buffet breakfast: it was very various and it was served since very early morning (so I was not deprived of it before my morning flight). The price was not cheap (fortunately, I didn't paid it myself) but reasonable and the hotel definitely worths it.

title: Amazing hotel
comment: Hotel is very beaituful.  There is a lot of bars and a la carte restaurants.We could easily make reservation for a la carte restaurants and we mostly liked to have a dinner in ottoman restaurant.

title: Good location to explore Lyon
comment: A basic, a bit dated hotel, but for this price you don't expect more. Situated across the river form the main city centre, but close to one of the bridges, so the walk takes only 10 minutes. The area around the hotel is not the nicest though. The hotel could do with some renovation. The check in took quite a bit of time, as the guest before me had some questions and they didn't have a second person. An alright hotel to stay for a night and explore the city, but if you need to stay longer, there are probably better options.

hotel.name: Hotel Campanile Lyon Centre-Berges du Rhône

title: Good - but the restaurant is a dive!
comment:
For fast in and out as business traveller for a couple of days it is OK - but Key Hotel and Swisshotel are far better and offer more for the business traveller in terms of service!
The sports (pool) area is boring and small. Only plus is the view of the city from the fitness room.
The roof top bar is great and unmatched by other hotels.
The restaurant is OK for breakfast but incredibly boring for lunch and dinner.

title: Nice hotel in the middle of Holland.
comment: Nice *** star hotel in the middle of Holland. Good start up for excursions, and also not far away from Utrecht, Amsterdam, and The Haque. The hotel is a little bid old furnished. The central location and the friendly staff is perfect. There is no restaurant for lunch or dinner. The hotel is working together with diffrent restaurants in the city of Woerden. Breakfast is good. There is free WIFI in the hotel. Nice hotel for this price.

title: Very bad hotel
comment: There are mice in the hotel room. All furniture is in very poor conditions. However the location is very good. it is close to all attractions and amenities. The size of room is  reasonable, but floor, walls and  ceiling are in very poor conditions. The breakfast is very modest and the choice is very poor.  In overall I would not recommend this hotel. It is really very basic.

title: I am very upset about this hotel!
comment:
The room I was staying in was very old-fashioned. When you come in the door, on the left hand side there is a old cabinet and old commode with an very old tube television.
I am no technical novice, but I tried 5 minutes hard, to get this TV working...I even was thinking about calling the room service, to ask about the TV. 
After the TV worked, I settled down on my bed, but what was the first thing to see??? You guessed right, a big dirty spot on sheet.  After staying 10 minutes in the room I was already really angry!
 Dirty public restrooms 
 Friendly staff

title: Very welcoming!
comment:
The hotel has ample parking, and a great lobby. The rooms were clean and comfortable; the staff very attentive. Although we stayed at a very busy time (the last few days of Octoberfest), the staff paid attention to detail and we felt very welcome. Make sure to go downstairs for a nice breakfast; the buffet had a fantastic healthy selection!

Make sure to unload your luggage at the entrance, as there is a set of stairs from the parking lot.

title: The Vivaldi Hotel, quaint & friendly
comment: The Vivaldi Hotel (Puteaux, France) is in walking distance to the metro (Paris).  Although the room was small it was clean and quite servicable (we spent most days sight-seeing in Paris.  We were treated to a full breakfast daily and the staff was friendly and very patient.  Special thank you(s) to the guest services associates Oliver & Marjoleine.  They were both helpful in providing directions and general info.  My wife and I especially enjoyed speaking with Oliver, and exchanging our respective views on life in France and the U.S.  I do not know when we will get to France (Europe) again, but we will definitely consider the Vivaldi Hotel again.

title: Good !
comment:
Brilliant holiday except from the food the food was diabolical. Apart from the food my holiday was brilliant all because of alanani rocko axaha and the sandman wagdy helal !
i couldn't go back 2 this hotel because i had hardly eaten all holiday
alanani, rocko and axaha should be working in a five star hotel because they were brilliant!

hotel.name: Sunrise Select Garden Beach Resort & Spa

title: Close to the airport, far from Paris
comment:
After a business meeting in Paris, I lost my flight back due to the proverbial after-work traffic. I looked for accomodation at the ariport and found Ibis Hotel Paris Charles de Gaulle Paris Nord 2 a reasonable one. The price is ok, the rooms are clean and functional. This is surely not a hotel to stay when you want to visit Paris, but is a choice to consider when you just want to spend a night and get fast to the airport first thing in the morning.

Appart from that, nothing special. Big, clean, impersonal. Staff can be friendly or not. Restaurants are ok, but not outstanding.

title: Very Upsale Hotel, In the Center of the City
comment: The hotel is upscale and very expensive.  It is a really nice hotel in great condition and very easy to travel to anywhere in the city.  I walked mostly everywhere I wanted to go.  Numerous shopping and dining areas within walking distance.

title: A very pleasant place
comment: This is a very pleasant hotel. The neightborhood is nice, very central. It is few minutes away from everything you might need. The rooms are big and very clean. The bathroom is'n extremely large but yet comfortable and clean. Internet connection is free and high speed. A nice table to work in your room. Definitively a good place for a business trip or a holiday.

title: Budget stay in Paris
comment:
I suppose you get what you pay for. The breakfast was decent enough. The accommodation itself left something to be desired: the room was rather small (the twin bed took up 2/3rds of the space); the bathroom was very small, with gaps in the wall and exposed pipes that were rather noisy. There was a certain amount of dust on the floor.
The location itself was rather good, with a number of decent shops and restaurants that I made use of.

title: Great stay at Ibis Bilbao in November
comment:
It is one of the Ibis chain hotels and , as such, it offers a business oriented services, everything is clean, the amenities are well known at the time of booking. Not a place for family with kids or if you are used at 4/5* comfort.
The place is good enough for couples in leisure holidays or for business trips.
Great location not far from the city centers and we never needed any bus ride during our stay. Many restaurants are close by, the receptionists have been happy to give a recommendation about cheap place to eat and the best neighborhoods for pintxos hopping!!!!!

title: Cheap yet Comfy Option 2 days in Amsterdam South
comment:
This hotel lies in the south of Amsterdam.

The area around is not what you expect from Amsterdam. However, a Tram stop is less than 5 minutes away walking from the hotel. From there it was almost 20 minutes to downtown Amsterdam.

The hotel rooms are OK by European standards. Might be small for American standards. The rooms are very clean and the staff there are very polite and speak excellent English.

title: Absolutely horrible accommodation for the money
comment: Tiny room, no place to put luggage. Dark, crazily designed bathroom with no electrical outlet, no soap dish in shower (no bathtub), minuscule shelf for personal amenities. Room was fully visible from the outside, and cleaning staff left curtains open daily, allowing anyone to see your belongings. Meager, horrible breakfast, on a frigid outdoor terrace (in February), with no indoor option whatsoever. Entrance to rooms only by passing through bar area. Totally overpriced, lousy service, bad location (noise from houses close-by). To be avoided at all costs.

title: IBIS Leeds city center
comment:
The Ibis Leeds is generally a good hotel for its price.
I would say its a good 2 star hotel. Its clean and satisfies all the basic needs, The room i got was small but functional - it had TV, Closed and a desk. the bed wasn't the most comfortable but was 'ok'. the bath room was small but had a cool design.
Other than that the receptionists were very friendly and quick.
There was not much diversity on breakfast but it was fresh and in good quality.
The hotel is about a 20 minutes walking distance from the city center and theres nothing around.
If you're low on budget its the place for you.

title: Good value for money
comment:
Very good value for money, competent and friendly personnel willing to help and offer a good service. 
Excellent room space and cleanliness. Very good restaurant and bar.
The location is excellent too close to the central square which makes it very easy to walk around.
 Breakfast  is not bad but not as good as food in the restaurant, however, the coffee is not good. WiFi is free but not stable making it annoying when you lose connection and have to login again.

hotel.city: Krakow - Lesser Poland Province - Southern Poland
hotel.name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Krakow

title: French 'n friendly
comment: Nice hotel with a friendly and helpful staff, but very small rooms. Found the socks of the previous guest under the bed, which tells something about the cleaning efforts. There are good patisseries and brasseries nearby, so we skipped the hotel breakfast. The metro (station Les Gobelins) is pretty close, and bus stops to take you to the centre or the other side of the river are also nearby. And the Luxemburg gardens are also in walking distance. During the stay we were not able to connect to the Wifi, not even with the help of the staff. So, this hotel is well located, but don't expect anything beyond basics.

title: Central location
comment:
Good location, 2 minutes from Duomo, but very loud location,  not possible to have a quite night sleep at all. Very small rooms,  old furnished. Frankly only to recommend for young students who do not need sleep in the night and need a good location for little money! Not a comfortable hotel at all.  The rooms are not worth its price even for 50 euro a night. Breakfast is no go, but there are enough good locations everywhere to have a good coffee and snack in the morning. Upper rooms were very small without own bathrooms and WC. 

So, it is not really a hotel, but low budget room accommodation. I wil not recommend anyone to stay there. Sorry :-)

title: One of the cleanest Travelodges I've been to!
comment: This Travelodge is well placed in the City Centre and a short walk from the station and a short walk to the shops, restaurants etc. that Leeds has to offer. The rooms are one of the cleanest Travelodges I've been too however the corridors and reception area is a little rough from all of the Hen/Stag weekend traffic. There were a few Stag weekenders checking in when we were however we didn't experience any noise or unpleasantness that would stop us from coming back in the future for our city breaks to Leeds. It a good location, basic, clean and thats all I can ask for for the price.

title: Can not fault
comment:
I found this hotel one of the best I have stayed in while travelling in Europe for value and service.
I felt the attention to detail,  from the staffs attitudes to the room itself was exceptional.

title: Can not fault
comment:
I found this hotel one of the best I have stayed in while travelling in Europe for value and service.
I felt the attention to detail,  from the staffs attitudes to the room itself was exceptional.

title: Le Méridien Munich
comment: We have stayed in this hotel for 4 nights recently. Our room was a city view room facing Street.. So from a view perspective, there is nothing that we can wow about!!! The decor of the hotel is very old just another 3 star hotel standard!!! Nothing special!!! The room does have a LCD TV , i will not stay in this Hotel Again.

title: Bit pricey and but away from center
comment:
You need to count 20-30 minutes walking time to get to Dubling city center from this hotel. There is no sauna nor swimming pool. Flat TV with discovery but no HBO. 
In my room mattress was ok and it was quiet but I had room with view on wall :) Most of colleagues were complaining for the mattresses being old and some for noises from outside (train in particular). 
Service on the other hand was very good and the stuff is quite international :)
But still I had to ask for the welcome drink voucher. 
We've got special price of 160 EUR/night, normal price was 199 EUR/night including breakfast. I think it's too much for what it offers.

hotel.city: Dublin - County Dublin - Province of Leinster
hotel.name: Hilton Dublin

title: Lovely hotel.
comment: Stayed at hotel for a week in June & again in October. Hotel is lovely, very clean & tidy. Staff were lovely and willing to assist with anything they could help with. Both times all inclusive, food was okay, got abit repetitive at times so opted to visit the sister hotel next door on a few occasions as there appeared to be more of a variety there also a few visits where payed to mcdonalds wich is situated only a 5 minute walk away. On 1st visit in June there appeared to be hardly any English people at all staying in the hotel, mainly German & Russian, yet on our second stay, there were quite a few english families.

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing staff best holiday
comment: The room was lovely, cleaned really well everyday with a beautiful view, food tasted good and there was lots of choice the hotel is the nicest i have ever stayed in and exceeded my expectations.

hotel.name: Sunrise Select Garden Beach Resort & Spa

title: Excellent location
comment: This hotel has an excellent location, just across the bridge from the Palace of Westminster and at walking distance to numerous touristic attractions. Within 5 minutes walking distance were tube stations and bus stations. We enjoyed fast and smooth check-in and check-out procedures. The studio rooms were very spacious, luxurious and kept very clean, with modern furniture and relaxing colors. Bathroom is large and good quality toiletries were provided, including bathrobes and slippers for the entire family. We appreciated the self-catering facilities provided and complimentary access to internet. Definitely we will be back at this hotel, next time in London.

title: Good 4 stars hotel
comment: The Empire Palace is a good 4 stars hotel. Good staff, comfortable bed and great breakfast. Both room and bathroom were a bit small though. It’s within walking distance of Rome’s most important sights.

title: Very disappointing, over-priced and rude staff
comment: Hotel is very over-priced considering that you get dated rooms with old and hard linen, towels etc., poor selection and quality of food at breakfast and many parts of the hotel were closed or under refurbishment, rude and unfriendly staff ruined our stay and the hotel boasts about its art collection when it should pay more attention to customer service and standards for guests

title: Looks definitely don't mean anything
comment:
The reception area looks very good, and almost newly decorated. The outside looks dated, but in a good enough state. This doesn't describe the state of the rooms themselves though.

The hotel offers Wireless Internet for an additional €15 Euros for 24 hours, which is okay, but in my opinion should be free nowadays.

The other guests that I have seen were labourers probably from one of our eastern European countries and working in Paris; in addition I have to say that I also have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels where people look fine, but from personality are far worse.
Looks definitely don't mean anything!

title: City of good food
comment: The hotel is laying in the real center of Lyon and the old parts of town is all around. Very close there are lots of narrow old streets with shopping of all kind and you can also find excusive cloth boutiques, antic shops for books and funiture, etc. Afew blocks away there ia also a large walking street with shopping and restaurants and in every corner you will find bars where you can sit down and rest your legs and cool down with a drink! There is a lot of historical place to visit and if interested in real good gastronomic eating then you make a visit to famous Paul Bocuse restaurant.

title: Too expensive for ordinary service
comment: The only advantage of this hotel is location. It is located 7 minutes away by foot from Amsterdam cetral train terminal. The price is too expensive for such ordinary service. The room is too small, the bathroom is not clean, moreover, there was a problem with bathroom equipment - after the shower always water on the floor. The food was very usual - fast food on breakfast. The booking conditions were - free cancelation, but they charged me full amount with no explanation. I have spend 1 month to get my money back. It was employee's fault. Anyway, think before making booking of this hotel.

title: Great location but no! I would not go back!
comment: I stayed there for a business trips with several other colleagues. I had a studio room with a "kitchen"... Well the kichen was old, gross and kind in a "cupboard". Not a lot of space in the room (a general issue in Paris anyway) and an old bathroom. Breakfast is brought to the room, quality is very poor (better of going out to grab a croissant...). Service is not reliable: several mistakes made in the orders (happened to me and some colleagues.. tea instead of coffee, no show, getting 2 breakfasts instead of 1...). Definetely to be avoided except if you want to be near the Arc de Trimphe and Champs Elysees but there are better options around.

hotel.name: Hotel Adagio Access Paris Tilsitt Champs-Elysées

title: Budget hotel at the Terminale Centrale, Milan
comment: This hotel is located a couple of blocks from the central Railway station in Milan, Italy, called Terminal Centrale. This budget hotel is in a generally OK condition, the room and the bathroom were in a good shape. Given the fact that it is located at a major intersection the noise level was higher than usual. The only bad thing was, that the restaurant area and the breakfast was really poor quality, and they even charged us despite the fact that we had that covered in the reservations. After complaining at the check out, it was obvious that the receptionist will not confirm what the "check-in" receptionist already did, that our reservation covers the breakfast as well!

title: Good choice
comment:
We stayed for just one night in the hotel and our main focus was to do some sight seeing in Lyon. The hotel is located very close to the subway station and it takes just a few stations to the inner city. So the location is very convenient. There were parking spaces available in front of the hotel.
When checking in and out the staff was very friendly.
Our room was spacy and clean and the bathroom was clean as well.
Since we didn't have breakfast I can't judge the restaurant.
In summary the hotel is a good option for short stays/ city breaks.

title: Up to expectations for a Holiday Inn Express
comment:
We stayed here with a group of 8 people during a short city break. The location is great, just a few minutes walking from a shopping street /area with plenty of shops (including a supermarket), bars and restaurants. The property respected frequent guest status and offered free internet as the property only has 1 room type and no upgrades were available.

Amenities at the hotel are minimal (there's not real bar, but a vending machine is available on the ground floor with sodas, sandwiches and snacks). No great luxury, but when looking for affordable, clean accommodation in a good location, then this is your spot!

hotel.name: Hotel Express By Holiday Inn Barcelona City 22@

title: Amazing holiday
comment:
The hotel was massive and had everything that I could possibly need. 

Amazing value for money and excellent location. The staff were AMAZING, they made the whole holiday and even to the point where we extended our stay. Loved the amination staff especially Eran, is a true friend for life

hotel.city: Turgutreis - Bodrum Peninsula - Mugla Province - Turkish Aegean Coast
hotel.name: Yasmin Resort Hotel

title: The worse Hotel In Miami South Beach
comment: I booked this hotel for seven days but after two nights I had to change it. From the room you can hear every noice. A party took place in the room next to mine and lasted until 3am. After calling the reception at 2am asking to contact the persons in the room to finish the party, nothing happened. The bed, especially the mattress were unconfortable!

title: Come only when you are a family with lots of kids!
comment:
This was a weird stay. Tho Hotel it's self was okay. There were just ALOT of people. Seemed like the staff couldn't handle  the amount of people. The food was DELICIOUS - one you got to it. 
The pool area is crowded as hell. No room there.
Very loud music.
The beach was very nice. Water was very clean.
Room cleaning was terrible. Complaints handling took hours.

Only go when you like ALOT of people.:)

title: Centrally located but low value hotel
comment: For 160€ without breakfast I believe I should get a decent room also in Paris, but this was not the case. The room size is unbearable and the bathroom is even smaller. Asked for an iron than never arrived, they offered me access to the full continental breakfast: what a shame, and they even charge some 13€ for that. Not recommended at all!

title: Good value for money
comment:
As a HH Diamond I booked a standard guest room and got upgraded to an Executive room. Even though the hotel is build in the 70s everything was in good shape. Lobby, Executive Lounge and Room left a good impression. The rooms are on the smaller side but again my room seemed to be in good shape.
As a Diamond you get the choice of breakfast either in the Exec. Lounge or restaurant. As I had a very early flight I did not get a chance to try the breakfast.
Checkin was fast, convenient and friendly. 
With a rate of 95€ the price was good food an airport hotel. Would recommend when in transit.

title: Great location, small rooms
comment: Stayed here before and after an educational conference in Barcelona (our plane flew into Madrid). The location of this hotel can't be beat. It is minutes from numerous restaurants, bars, etc. and centrally located between the Prado and the Palace -- great for walking. The Metro also has a key station minutes from the front door. The staff were helpful. The rooms were on the small side and the amenities (like Internet access) were spotty at best. But it was great value for an adult vacation in Madrid.

title: Ideally Situated  in the heart of Florence
comment: The hotel staff were warm and welcoming and were always helpful with directions . The breakfast was adequate - not many varieties of bread and good coffee. The only glitch - no eggs scrambled or otherwise because of delivery issues during weekends. A 4 star hotel should have  some items of hot breakfast.  The attending staff were nice and friendly in the breakfast room. I found the hotel clean and well maintained the AC worked perfectly . The guests seemed to be mainly Italian , British and American. The hotel provides for little but important things like razor with gel , bus tickets. Internet centre was great.

title: Idea Hotel Milano San Siro
comment: The hotel is located near the ring road , near the football stadium. So initially you want to recommend it to football fans and those who drive. In general, the hotel is modern , with a large car park. Service is normal. Maid service is good. The staff is friendly , but once again not work (when we arrived , we had to ourselves dostovat much luggage and carry in our room ) . Breakfast at the hotel buffet , no frills. Ofitsyanty while working well. Had dinner in the city, as in the evening in the hotel bar just worked . In general, a positive impression of the hotel .

title: Hotel Titanic Beach Spa & Aqua Park
comment: This hotel was fantastic the staff can't do enough for you. They are friendly and funny. The food was good and varied. the complex is vast and beautiful. The rooms are immaculately clean and it is an all inclusive package. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Conveniently located on Södermalm, close to the tube
comment: I am often on business trips and I know what need. Apart from a bed, I do also ask for a big bathroom, which the standard rooms in this hotel offers. On the day I had been in a number of meetings, so when coming back, I did appreciate that the hotel was quiet and offered a restaurant which had a great selection of different foods. Do try their fish, I had a delicious meal that evening. The check-out was alright, two other guests took quite some time to check out and no other member of staff was called to the reception to speed up the checkout process for the other guests.

title: Never again
comment:
loud and noisy, despite rule tat fron 22;00 everything must be quit, staff says; bad luck'also staaf was responsible for serious damage on my motorcycle, which was put in a bike shed'only they could enter'
no adequate respons to that.
So, same price as cheap hotel, crappy room, food is horrible, we left it and went into town for food, no night rest and a few 100 euro damage on motorbike..

title: Absolutely gorgeous and super relaxing hotel
comment:
Stayed here with my wife for a short holiday.
